name: Classic Brandy Peppercorn Cream Sauce
instructions: After cooking your steak, reduce the pan heat to medium-low and discard the garlic and herbs.
Add crushed peppercorns and minced shallot to the pan. Saut√© for about 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add brandy and stir, scraping up any browned bits (fond). Let it reduce by half.
Add beef stock and reduce again until slightly thickened. Keep the heat moderate to avoid scorching if using stainless steel.
Stir in the cream and optional Dijon mustard. Simmer gently until the sauce coats the back of a spoon.
Remove from heat and stir in cold butter to finish the sauce and add sheen.
Serve immediately over sliced steak or on the side.

storage_tips.room_temp: Not recommended. Sauce should be cooled and refrigerated within 2 hours.
storage_tips.freezing_cooked: Not ideal, as cream sauces can split when reheated. Best made fresh or stored up to 3 days in the fridge.
